results.title: Peter and the wolf
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Disney’s animated version of “Peter and the Wolf” follows several years after his classic film “Fantasia”. Disney continues his use of music and detailed animation with music from Sergei Prokofiev matched to the characters of the story. Each character is introduced at the beginning of the tale with their appropriate musical instrument from the orchestra. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Peter Allen: the boy from Oz
results.creator_credit: Stephen MacLean, Ben Gannon, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gannon TV Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Allen’s tragic death from AIDS, left the music world bereft of one of the most flamboyant and energetic entertainers. His music, particularly the song “I still call Australia home”, touched the hearts of millions. This documentary looks at Peter’s life and includes interviews with well-known celebrities, family and friends, and brings into focus some of the broader social issues associated with his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen MacLean, Ben Gannon, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gannon TV Productions

results.title: Peter & Paul and the Christian revolution
results.creator_credit: Margaret Koval, Patricia Aste and Koval Films LLC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
Traces the life of early Christians Peter and Paul, who faced powerful obstacles - including the mighty Roman Empire, political persecution and crippling personal disagreements - in their attempts to spread the word of Jesus. Episode 1. “The Rock and the river” - With the Messiah dead and their cause deemed subversive, the followers of Jesus face a bleak future, until their hope is re-invigorated by a vision of the risen Jesus. A former persecutor of Christians, Peter soon becomes an indomitable figure, uniting the group into a tight community of ardent believers. Paul, educated, passionate, determined and dogmatic, uses his formidable talents to spread his new beliefs around the Roman Empire. Episode 2. “The Empire and the Kingdom” - Led by missionaries, Christian ideas continue to spread among Jews and non-Jews throughout the Empire; hostile locals, imperial forces and conflicting ideas threaten the future of the movement. Paul splits with his former allies, establishing churches in his image; in 70 AD, after decades of tensions, a four-year war erupts that destroys much of Jerusalem, but the communities established by Paul survive and grow. Fascinating work features the words of Paul and other ancient writers, historical re-enactments and interviews with contemporary scholars.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Koval, Patricia Aste and Koval Films LLC

results.title: Peter's chair
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Using Ezra Jack Keats book as a basis, this film tells of the jealousy Peter feels at the arrival of his baby sister and how his world is put to rights again. Good use of music and amusing and entertaining voice-overs.

results.title: Peter
results.creator_credit: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Cowboy Films, Film London, Fresh One Productions and Channel 4
results.brief_description: In a semi-empty swimming pool Peter engages in a series of very intense warming up and breathing exercises. He stretches, flexes, inhales and exhales to finally plunge in the water and re-emerges fully satisfied.

results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.
results.title_for_label: Pete’s pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery

results.title: Pet shop
results.brief_description: A four screen looping animation work, Pet Shop pulls at the heart strings with its adorably cute 2D animated animals. Corompt’s work uses reductive and stylised modes of representation, exploring how we engage with these synthetic characters. The unquie relationship that exists between spectator and subject, inviting the spectator to partake in an unspoken agreement, where they may teeter on the boundary of the objectivity and empathy, simultaneously acknowledging its artifice, while at the same time participating in its pathos.

results.title: Pesticides: friend or foe?
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Bruce Moir and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the need for great care in the preparation and use of pesticides. A home gardener and a farmer each make many mistakes when spraying. Shows the mistakes, the dangerous results and the correct procedures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders, Bruce Moir and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Pesticides
results.creator_credit: Robert Richter, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of their danger to humans or the environment are knowingly exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in pesticides.
